critique: The document is a directive focused on aeronautics research and development. It outlines the policy of the United States to facilitate progress in aeronautics R&D through government funding and activities, in cooperation with various entities. It assigns functions to the Director of the Office of Science and Technology Policy to implement this policy, including reviewing funding, recommending actions, and developing a national plan for aeronautics R&D. The document emphasizes coordination among government agencies and with external organizations. It also includes general provisions regarding implementation, consistency with applicable law, and the absence of enforceable rights or benefits.
